files.description: Description of the various files on the Dataverse page. Also includes a description of the six-step algorithm for drawing dynamic model effects with confidence intervals.
files.label: docMediaCount.txt

dataFile.description: Description of the various files on the Dataverse page. Also includes a description of the six-step algorithm for drawing dynamic model effects with confidence intervals.

files.description: R code used to estimate models of news coverage of church and state issues. A transfer function, negative binomial regression, Koyck model, log-normal model, and Poission autoregressive model were estimated. This code also graphically illustrates the dynamic effect of the Lynch v. Donnelly case and computes long-run effects for other predictors. Requires the input data file woodCHURCH1.csv.
files.label: fbw.R

dataFile.description: R code used to estimate models of news coverage of church and state issues. A transfer function, negative binomial regression, Koyck model, log-normal model, and Poission autoregressive model were estimated. This code also graphically illustrates the dynamic effect of the Lynch v. Donnelly case and computes long-run effects for other predictors. Requires the input data file woodCHURCH1.csv.

files.description: Data on TV coverage on energy policy. Usage of these data requires citation of the following study: Peake, J. S. and Eshbaugh-Soha, M. (2008). The agenda-setting impact of major presidential TV addresses. Political Communication 25:113–137.
files.label: PESenergy.csv

dataFile.description: Data on TV coverage on energy policy. Usage of these data requires citation of the following study: Peake, J. S. and Eshbaugh-Soha, M. (2008). The agenda-setting impact of major presidential TV addresses. Political Communication 25:113–137.

files.description: R code used to estimate models of news coverage of energy policy. A transfer function, negative binomial regression, Koyck model, log-normal model, and Poission autoregressive model were estimated. This code also graphically illustrates the dynamic effect of Nixon's November 1973 speech on the issue and computes long-run effects for other predictors. Requires the input data file PESenergy.csv.
files.label: pes.R

dataFile.description: R code used to estimate models of news coverage of energy policy. A transfer function, negative binomial regression, Koyck model, log-normal model, and Poission autoregressive model were estimated. This code also graphically illustrates the dynamic effect of Nixon's November 1973 speech on the issue and computes long-run effects for other predictors. Requires the input data file PESenergy.csv.

files.description: Data on New York Times and USA Today coverage of gay rights. Usage of these data requires citation of the following study: Ura, J. D. (2009). The Supreme Court and issue attention: The case of homosexuality. Political Communication 26:430–446.
files.label: UraData.csv

dataFile.description: Data on New York Times and USA Today coverage of gay rights. Usage of these data requires citation of the following study: Ura, J. D. (2009). The Supreme Court and issue attention: The case of homosexuality. Political Communication 26:430–446.

files.description: R code used to estimate models of news coverage of homosexuality. A transfer function, negative binomial regression, Koyck model, log-normal model, and Poission autoregressive model were estimated. This code also graphically illustrates the dynamic effect of the Romer v. Evans case and computes long-run effects for the Lawrence v. Texas case. Requires the input data file UraData.csv.
files.label: ura.R

dataFile.description: R code used to estimate models of news coverage of homosexuality. A transfer function, negative binomial regression, Koyck model, log-normal model, and Poission autoregressive model were estimated. This code also graphically illustrates the dynamic effect of the Romer v. Evans case and computes long-run effects for the Lawrence v. Texas case. Requires the input data file UraData.csv.
